AND all the staff are unbelievably wonderful and attend to your every need. 

The place is always packed on the weekends.
author: Best M.

description: Love this place.  The food is great and just as important the people working there are warm and they keep it real.  My favorite neighborhood restaurant on Valencia.
author: Seidman W.

description:
It's so difficult to find some good Indian food which my friends (not Indians) can enjoy! 

Food quality: great! Everything was delicious. The servers ask how spicy you'd prefer the food, and I felt that everything came out accordingly. Our table ordered the paneer makhani, butter chicken (murgh makhani), shish kebob, tandoori plate, and four orders of naan (two plain and two garlic basil.) One warning - none of the dishes come with naan, you have to order it separately, which is slightly annoying but oh well. The shish kebob was mediocre, but everything else was really delicious. Presentation was also great!

Ambience/Service: ambience was very welcoming and warm. The service was great as well. We were seated promptly and all the orders came out properly.

Cost: The restaurant is a bit pricey, but it didn't seem too unusual for SF, plus, the food quality was terrific.

Would I go back/take my family there: Absolutely.
author: Karina K.

description: Very expensive for what is given, portions are small. Had to ask for multiple portions of rice and extra rice in order for everyone to be fed. Wait staff worked hard!
author: Shawn L.

description:
Amazing Indian food. Finally a place where they cook it fresh and the gravies have different tastes. It's not the same gravy recycled with different names.
Aloo vindaloo's gravy was flavorful and yummy.
Oh and their spiked lassis are awesome.
author: Archie R.

description:
If you are craving Indian food, then this  can be a good spot to satisfy your cravings. The food here does not necessarily standout compared to other Indian restaurants I have visited, but is not bad either. Between 5 of my friends, we ordered 4 curry dishes and 7-8 naans (garlic/onion). The bill came out to be about $110-$120.

Personally, I thought that the Chicken Tikka Masala was a bit under-spiced and the chicken overcooked and dry. Their lamb did not particularly standout either in terms of taste or seasoning. For the price point, I think there are better options.

Pros:
- Standard Indian food
- Big restaurant = available seating + can accommodate larger parties 

Potential Improvements:
- Add more spices into the curry dishes
- Re-evaluate the price point
author: Jeff M.

description: Came here for late dinner with the friends. Good food and good service. It seemed a clean place although the lights were pretty dimmed so it was rather hard to tell. We ordered their vegetable special chicken and Paulo and some assortments of appetizers and bread. If u feel like Indian in the city highly recommend it.
author: Saleh R.

description:
I was looking for a good place in the city to take my parents for dinner and came upon this place because it had a ton of great reviews. I was pretty impressed by this place - the food was great, the ambience was pretty nice for an indian restaurant, and the staff was pleasantly friendly. I ordered the nimbu pani to drink after reading all the good reviews about it, but I personally wouldn't recommend it, I've definitely had better. For food we ordered:

Saag Paneer: Even though there wasn't a lot of paneer in this dish, I still really enjoyed it - it felt like I was eating something healthy because of the spinach, but it still tasted very good as well.

Daal: Average daal, but it was a good addition to the rest of the otherwise heavy food.

Bhindi Masala: Pretty good bhindi, considering that this is a hard dish to make exceptional, but I really enjoyed the flavors of this dish.  

Murgh Makhani: The was so yum! Deliciously creamy and the perfect amount of spicy, it was a great chicken dish.

Raita, Pickle and Chopped Onions: I understand a restaurant charging for raiti, but I've never seen any place charge extra for pickle and chopped onions - definitely a surprise to see that on the bill. 

Although a little pricy in the end, it was a good, fun meal and would recommend it!
author: Malika R.

description: I made reservations for a Friday at 7pm. The place was empty, so we went down the street to LoLo's, which was more lively with excellent food.
author: JH J.

description: We've been here for an hour and our food has not been served.  The waiters are ignoring our pleas for attention.  The service is worse than the DMV.
author: Robert N.

description:
Fabulous food on Valencia is nothing new, but if you enjoy Indian cuisine, Aslam's Rasoi should be added to your bookmark list.

Miryam S. and I enjoyed the Began Bartha, Garlic Basil Naan, Lamb Vindaloo, Rice and Vegetable Pakoras (on the house).  Our server, Asif Aslam (his father is the chef and owner), was friendly, warm and provided excellent service. We were interested in sipping some vino with our dinner, so he brought out three white wines for us to sample. (We decided on the Claiborne and Churchill Dry Gewurztraminer, $10/glass.) On the way out, we stopped over at the bar to say good-bye to Asif A. and he offered us dessert shots. Cheers! 

This gem of a restaurant would be a great place for both a dinner date or group of friends due to the intimate atmosphere, well-executed dishes, amazing service and well-matched prices for the quantity and quality of the food.
author: Liv K.

description:
A Serious Indian Food Craving + A Colorful, Crowded, and Understaffed Dining Room + Awkwardly Configured 2 Top Tables + 

2 Hunger Abating Vegetable Samosas ($6) + Deliciously Cool Yogurt Mint Sauce + Ignored Tamarind Sauce + 

Tasty "Medium" (Actually Mild) Spicy Chicken Tikka Masala ($13) + Surprisingly Juicy and Spicy Ground Lamb Kebab ($14) + 1 Order of not very Garilcky or Basil-y Naan ($3) + Rice ($3) =

NEXT TIME TAKEOUT
author: Amy C.

description:
My first time here but hands down it's one of the top places for Indian food in San Francisco. 

# The chicken tikka masala was pretty awesome; the naan/breads were great too. 
# Despite the rush, the service was quick. 
# Good value for money.
author: Parakram K.

description: I wish I could give 5 stars for food and one star for quantity. Despite the food, I will not be ordering from here again because of the quantity. My friend and I got delivery, and had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Bengan Bartha (and two naan). The takeout containers were half the size of a normal takeout container, and as a result, we barely had enough to feed two smallish, not terribly hungry women. The portion sizes were literally half of normal size, and the prices were 30-50% more. Not a good combination. Yummy, complex food. They just need more of it. Maybe as a last ditch effort I'll order at the restaurant and see if you get more at the table.
author: Rachel R.

description: I came here with my girlfriend and we left very satisfied. The food is so good, you get a real sense of the Indian culinary culture. The mangolassi drink is to die for, you must try it. It is a mango smoothie that will make you want to finish it after the first sip.
author: John O.

description:
Great food!

Randomly came here one night with my dad while he was visiting, based on the other yelp reviews, and I'm so glad we picked it. 

We had great service throughout the meal, and fantastic food. I've since been back, for take-out, one on one dinners with a friend, and with large groups - all have been great. 

It's a touch pricey for a casual dinner, but quality of the food is 100% worth it. There is something about their sauces that is just... better. I can't quite put my finger on it. 
I used to go to an Indian place in west portal - but stopped after the quality dipped. I came to find out that the chef moved on to open this place - and then my love for their food all made sense! 

I've since had a mix of most things on their menu and have yet to get something that isn't really good. Although I have a particular addiction to their Chicken Murg Makhani. 

Do note that if you go during peak dinner hours, the service can start to get a bit slower, but that's true with many a restaurant. But I've always had good service when I get there before 7.

Street parking can be pretty difficult (it's on Valencia, after all), but it's a short walk from the 24th street BART station, and there is a parking garage within a few blocks.
author: Diane W.

description:
My first time here was actually my first time having Indian food. Not one to be an adventurous diner, especially regarding ethnic food, I was definitely apprehensive. Fortunately my friends know me well, so they helped me pick less risky plates. I ordered the chicken tiki masala for myself but I ended up sharing everyone's plates. All the flavors were divine, the lamb was sooo tender and the naan was really good.

All the staff is very friendly, especially the owner, who makes regular rounds. You get the feeling he really cares about you as a customer and can tell he takes pride in his business. The second time I went, my group and I were placed in the back corner by the kitchen and we were slightly neglected so service was kind of slow.

Overall, though, Aslam's Rasoi is wonderful and I'd definitely recommend it.
author: Lindsay H.

description:
Tough, I really wanted to like this place and have dined here twice but find the food to be average and expensive for what it is. We've had the rogan josht and found it lacking in seasoning, the baigan bharta was very oily and sag paneer to be uneventful really.

I guess with Amber Dharba closed down the street, it's Aslam's and Udupi Palace (if you want vegetarian).  As for Dosa, I prefer the one on Fillmore. We need good Indian restaurants in San Francisco!
author: Favoloso M.

description: Yum tasty authentic indian food. A bit expensive, but it matches the ambience. Will definitely go here again.
author: Vinay K.

description:
Torn.

Food was good.

But paying $30+ for 2 Indian dishes (To Go) is about as blasphemous to me as it is to pay that much for Chinese food.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but I like to think paying a premium price for Chinese or Indian food should be banned (unless your first initials are P.F. or you have a fancy Asian Fusion theme to your restaurant).

And ESPECIALLY, since I know Masala and Paneer are probably NOT individually prepared to order, and are probably stewing in some ginormous caldron simmering in some delicious goodness.

Yay for food. Boo for price.
author: Victor C.

description: After a long search of trying to find a good Pakistani place in San Francisco, my search ended at Aslam's Rasoi. I talked to Aslam and he is from Gujranwala, a city with a strong food heritage and Aslam fully lives up to it
author: Faateh D.

description:
I love the food here! The Chicken Tikka Masala is one of my favorites in the city.

Sadly, I can no longer order from Aslam. They stopped supporting Doordash and eat24hours won't deliver to my address (2 miles away).

Please expand your delivery region or support Doordash again! Thanks!
author: Zachary P.

description:
The meals are small the service is not more then ok, the food is below the average.
And 20% as been charged for tip.
The bread was the best here but as the dishes it was little pieces so we order more and more
Not recommend
author: Francesco G.

description: Chicken jalfrezi.  It's the best Indian curry without a doubt, but I've had a tough time finding it in the U.S.  This place has it, so it's automatically a great restaurant.  The jalfrezi was good, along with the pakora, shrimp biryani, and garlic naan.  Especially given the reasonable prices, I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Simon L.

description:
OMG!!!! 

We went there last night for dinner, and let me tell you this is the best restaurant in the city!!!! We had the lamb chops and chicken tikka masala with garlic naan and rice. Hands down the best. Service was amazing and very attentive. The waiters and bussers had a smile the whole time we were there and were on top of everything. 10 stars for that, parking sucked I guess cause it was busy, so that's understandable other then finding a park two blocks away, it was a nice walk and view of the city. We will be back soon

P.s for the people that write bad reviews you guys don't know the quality of good food and service!!! Oh yea and cucumber taste better pickled
author: The D.

description:
Love this place!  The food is always flavorful. Service is great. The wines are ok. 

Back to the food, the spinach paneer is amazing,  the chana masala a must have, and of course chicken tika masala sets the standard high. 

I love the chutneys as well. I have never left here disappointed.
author: Jacklyn H.

description: Went to this place for late dinner after a long tiring drive. Awesome Indian food, tried chicken tikka and chicken jalfarezi with assorted breads. Everything was really good and tasty. Tried sula syrah from India which had a distinct spicy and tulsi taste which was also very good. Overall good experience, better than many other popular Indian places.
author: Shalini O.

description: Eating at this establishment has made me a huge fan of pakistani food period. No other descriptions about my visit are needed.
author: Eric M.

description: The food was good, but twice the price and service was not very attentive. I usually don't leave reviews, but felt pretty ignored, so was not too impressed with the service compared to what I paid.
author: Meleina H.

description:
I LOVE ASLAM'S ROSOI!!!! 
A well earned FIVE STARS! 

So this place was suggested to me, by my co worker; so a buddy and I decided to give this place a shot.

Let's start with the ambiance at the restaurant.... 
Absolutely lovely! Casual enough to have a random dinner night with friends, or formal enough to bring a date. The lighting and decor is lovely! There's plenty of seating, without making a person feel claustrophobic. There is also a cool bar. However, they do not carry any hard liquor at the bar, there are a few beers on tap, and wines. (I personally had a tangerine wheat beer.)
Moving onto the food now....
We ordered naan, rice, bhindi masala(okra), and chicken tikka masala. Both entrees were DELICIOUS!!!! The bhindi masala was freshly made, and perfectly accommodating to our love for spicy food. The chicken tikka masala was very savory and creamy, the chicken in it was tender. Overall food was BOMB.com!
 Moving onto the experience and the customer service...
EXCELLENT!!! We actually said hello to Asalm, the man himself! The servers are awesome, very accommodating and hospitable! 
I definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone! You won't be disappointed!
author: Kirandeep S.

description:
Best Indian food I had in San Francisco. I liked their nice dark ambience. It was a nice location too. 

I ordered Murgh Masala with Polao. It was delicious and I felt like ordering the same food a second round. They had an Italian Rosé that went pretty well with the food. I had Kulfi for dessert, which was absolutely amazing, had a very rich flavor with interesting spices. 

It was a bummer they didn't have Gulabjamun.
author: Anand M.

description: Placed an order online for food through Yelp's delivery service for this restaurant, Eat24.  After 1.5 hours I tracked down that not only had Eat 24's driver not bothered to pick up my order from the restaurant, but when I called the restaurant, the manager was instantly rude, dismissive of my concern and literally hung up on me.  If this is their version of customer service, I won't be going back.
author: Eric S.

description:
A solid entrant in the illustrious roll of authentic Pakistani restaurants in the tenderloin district. This is less of a dive and more of a proper dining facility. The food is well prepared and Fresh-made,  and so the dishes take their time coming to your table. 

Recommended to all who seek authentic Pakistani food
author: Umair K.

description:
10:30 at night and the place was thumping with Indian house music making me feel like I'd stepped into a nightclub.  I rather liked it.  

And then there were the servers (owners?) who were the most welcoming, gracious hosts I could hope for.  They were happy to let us sit anywhere, happy to tell us what they'd recommend, and then happy to comply when we said we wanted the eggplant dish "spicy... we like hot".  

What we got that the waiter recommended was some sizzlingly delicious chicken appetizer with onions and peppers.  It tasted like perfection when wrapped in garlic basil naan and topped by the pungent green sauce and sweet brown sauce  brought to our table.  

We fared less well on the eggplant dish as the only thing we could taste was HOT.  Be careful what you wish for.  Waiters were there though, keeping up well with our constant need for water refills.  

I watched as large parties left and there was a lot of hugging and friendly conversation going on between patrons and staff.  It felt like a real family atmosphere; a place where they'd know and remember you after a couple of visits.  I'm always up for a little extended family.  Especially one who fills my stomach with delicious things.  Next time, no "hot" and I'll put all my trust into the waiter to recommend and deliver a perfect meal.
author: Tracey A.

description: Really, really good indian food at Aslam's Rasoi. We had a selection of entrees for our party and some delicious appetizers. The naan bread was freshly made. The staff was super friendly, made excellent suggestions to balance off our menu selections and the service was fast. Had some great indian beer to wash it down with. Overall a real treat. Highly recommend.
author: Jerry M.

description:
The food here is just amazing. I just had a few dishes of chicken and it was as tender as it gets. Loved it! 
A suggestion to the business owners: Serve raita along with the biryani. It shouldn't be charged separately. Its like charging separately for syrup while ordering a pancake.
author: Kunal V.

description:
I would write a 5 star review if you bring back the Boti Kebab on the menu. I used to go here just for that! 

Ok the rest is pretty good too, but just doesn't compare.
author: Matthieu T.

description:
Aslam's Rasoi is the place people go to when they can't get a seat at Dosa,  let's be real.

I LIKE Aslam's Rasoi, don't get me wrong, but it's not 5 star worthy, however not a bad place to eat. 

The restaurant is large for being on Valencia, which I appreciate, because it's so hard to get in anywhere once the dinner rush hits and all the hipsters need to get their chow on. You aren't jammed next to other diners and there is room to move about. Nicely decorated, in that it's comfortable and soothing to the eye. 

The service was great, and I really enjoyed our plucky server, Rosie. She was very accommodating to my best friend and I. We were seated right away and our water glasses were always full. The food came out quickly and everything was hot and fresh.

The drawbacks were few, but noticeable. They were "out" of chai when we got there, which was after dinner rush. I'm not exactly sure how they were "out" of a staple at an Indian restaurant, but oh well. Things started to go sour when we were told they were also out of kheer (Indian rice pudding). Our server did suggest another dessert, but we weren't a fan of it. 

We almost left because they were out of two of our favorite Indian dishes. 

Instead of chai, Rosie brought us two other Indian drinks--a rose water infused Lassi and a special lemonade made with a hint of cardamom. Both were good, but it didn't hit the spot like chai would've.

The entrees weren't overly portioned (most likely not big enough to share if you have an appetite) and seemed dare I say bland. They give you a hearty serving of rice. 

Though it has nothing to do with service or quality, the people sitting next to us were incredibly loud and obnoxious and I got to hear all about this Marina girl's torrid romp on the roof of a building. Yikes. 

All in all, a decent place that was reasonably priced, but I'd rather splurge and go to Dosa.
author: Bianca U.

description: Ordered delivery service. Everything we ordered was yummy n tasty. Ordered the vegetarian biryani,tandoori chicken, basil n garlic naan, mixed seafood curry, bhidi masala
author: Rakhma I.

description: My goal has been to try all the Indian restaurants in the mission so this place was my next stop. I was not happy with the food here at all. We ordered the lamb korma and the chicken tikka masala with naan and rice. First, the dishes were barely even warm. Eating curry that isn't hot is not ok. The chicken tikka masala was probably the worst version I have ever eaten. The service was good though so that was nice.
author: Bhavisha P.

description:
First impression review:
- first off we were seated right away despite the fact that we had no reservations, people with bigger parties were waiting and it was packed but then again it was only two of us, they took our order fast and the customer service we had was phenomenal! We were super impressed. And the food was amazing! We ordered 3 different types of naan and the fish tandoori with rice  they were so freaking good! The mango lassi is out of this world I have nothing bad to say for this first time that I went. Will follow up when I go again
author: Evelyn Sophia C.

description: love this place... the waiter was very nice and kind. The food are exceptional... We went there last week on vacation... all of us love our food.
author: Kulnapa S.

description:
I've been here so many times and always loved it. Tried most of the dishes but definitely recommend the lamb. It's so much flavor and I haven't found other restaurants that can match it. 


Been here on dates, double dates and with a large group. Great location and environment. 

Best!
author: Jessica H.

description: Hands down the best Indian food in San Francisco. Staff is always super friendly and food is fast and flavorful. Definitely recommend the chicken tikka masala.
author: Sam S.

description: Awesome samosas, garlic and basil nan, prawns vindaloo.. good service.. tea is good as well..
author: Sharmila P.

description: This is the best Indian food I've had in SF yet! Very good. Great atmosphere. Not quite as spicy as I expected though.
author: Sarah E.

description: Mediocre food for the price. Ordered lamb biryani, which was super spice for my taste and I can definitely brave some heat. Service is terribly slow. I'm talking place your order, go run your errands, and some more and even then the food wouldn't arrive.
author: Abbas Y.

description:
Okay, so here's the truth, I'm new to this. 

So, I only recently became a fan of Indian and Middle Eastern food. With that said, I may not be a trusted force at what is considered good and quality Pakistani and Indian food. However, I do know one thing.. I like taste, and this place has it. 

This place is awesome. I love all the dips and dressings that have mint and cucumber. It really is a taste explosion. 

Recommendations:

Prawn Korma - Yum! In fact, all the Korma dishes are good.

Raita - One of my favorite things ever. These guys introduced me to one of my top 5 favorite foods. 

Naan - What more to say? This stuff is "moorish" as my English girlfriend would say

The food here is delicious, however the staff makes it that much better. We have always been treated with lots of attention and feel like family (although a very pale skinned family) when we're there.
author: Robert B.

description:
Very good food! I loved the atmosphere and the great service. 

I was here with a few of my college friends and we order various dishes and they were all great. 

I had the spiked mango lasi but I wasn't too impressed. They also have a full bar and a great selection of wine. 

It's defensively a good place for groups or an intimate dinner.
author: Liliana C.

description: Very impressed by the quality of the food here. The chicken jalfrezi and the garlic basil nan were both amazing. Wasn't too busy on a weeknight and the service was perfect.  Will be coming back again for sure!!
author: Neil B.

description: This is by far one of the best establishment by far. The food is very delicious and very well prepared. This is a family runned business and every employee provided me with excellent customer service. The signature dish they serve here are the lamb chops. The chef explained to me that it's marinated for 24 hours to keep the excellent taste. I would definitely recommended this to anyone who likes Pakistani and Indian food! The restaurant is also very clean and they rate 100% on the food safety scorecard. One thing i love about this restaurant is that all the employees are knowledgeable of what's on the menu and work as a team under pressure. This restaurant is golden and recently opened up a new location in Burlingame CA on Burlingame Ave.
author: Ed B.

description:
I came here twice.  The first time was with my brothers of my fraternity where we had reserved a large table, the second time was with my girlfriend.

My brothers have organized a very nice dinner for 16-20 of us, the restaurant was very accommodating when we had to add another seating arrangement.  The food was excellent, The restaurant was very nice in splitting the bill for all of us.  A brother and I decided to share so we can try more of their dishes.

Their samosas are very good, the chicken vindaloo was juicy, and the lamb biryani was decent.  Can't forget about the naan.  Service was excellent and we were all served in a timely manner, even for a large group.  This visit deserved 4 stars.

My second visit with my girlfriend was different.  We were seated quickly with a slight wait on a Friday night, it helped that I found parking nearly in front of the restaurant so we weren't terribly starving at that point.  We were seated near the corner near a corner table, and the way they packed the tables was inconvenient.  My chair was bumped when the patrons at the table next to us got up to use the facilities and when they left.  The table arrangements could be better.  I've ordered exact same items as when I was with my brothers, except the lamb and the chicken was over cooked.  The samosas were still amazing and the naan was slightly burnt.  This visit got 3 stars, decent table location, the samosas were the saving grace.

Was the change in quality the difference in party size, because both occasions I have been here was a Friday night and they were just as full.
author: Calvin T.

description: I wish I could make a rating based on the food, unfortunately my boyfriend and I waited at the front 5 minutes before being acknowledged. And another 15 before finally giving up and leaving as had tickets to see a show and could no longer wait. Not that I likely would have regardless as I was quite put off by the terrible service. Upsetting to be treated so poorly.
author: Kate B.

description: One of the best Indian food restaurants in San Francisco.  It's a neighborhood spot and the staff make us feel like family.  I know some feel the prices are to high but I know that the fresh ingredients are not cheap and you get what you pay for.  The prices make sense for what you get.  Consistently is very hard to achieve in the restaurant business, Aslam's Rasoi is always spot on.
author: Jesse L. N.

description:
Great food and great service!
- great tandoori chicken
- great mango lassi and rose yogurt
- lamb was fresh and chicken was juicy and tender
- great hospitality and environment, the server even gave extra rice to go, very considerate!
author: Maggie L.

description:
Simply put, Aslam's Rasoi is amazing. Food is wonderful, staff is courteous, and the ambiance is just right. I love going in the evenings when the candles are lit and it's dimmer in the restaurant, the art direction is fantastic as well. 

I'm not exaggerating when I say they have the best Mango Lassi in the city, because they truly do. Rich and creamy and not too sweet, just right. 

Portions are large so I would recommend ordering a bunch of dishes to share and sample. Everything was delicious and seasoned just right, my particular favorite was the Seekh Kebab and the Boti Kebab (I love lamb!). I will definitely be back for another visit!
author: Evin C.

description:
Food was pretty good, though pricey and the wait staff was ignoring us the whole time, even though the place was half empty, and we made a reservation (so it's not like we surprised them with a large group).

There are plenty of other Indian restaurants in the mission.
author: Dave R.

description:
Love everything about this place. 

1) food freaking rocks (especially for vegetarians). 
2) clean and amazing service!
3) try the iced chai!! SO good!

I've been here too many times, yet, not enough. Love. Love. Love.
author: Gina H.

description: Didn't taste great compared to other Indian stuff around, and the portions are incredibly small for the price tag attached. Not worth anyone's time.
author: John T.

description: Delicious food and ambiance! I had Rasoi's Rogan Josh (a lamb dish). It was simply delicious, meat was cooked to perfection with an excellent sauce!!
author: Favor M.

description:
I only have one complaint - price.  My husband and I ordered the mixed tandoori platter.  It came with two small prawns, two thumb sized lamb sausages, two literally bite-sized pieces of lamb, two bite-sized pieces of chicken, and a very petite, slim piece of tilapia cut in half.  It cost $22.  It was delicious, but for the amount of food, presentation, preparation, and decor, it was not worth it.

I'm not against paying for good food, but Aslam's pricing, on average, makes it more expensive on average than Mission Chinese Food and Udupi Palace (similar restaurants arguably at the top of their niche) and about as expensive as Beretta or Pizzeria Delfina.  Aslam's is not comparable in decor, service, or vibe to either.  

I recommend the food at Aslam's, but be careful.  It looks and feels like a chill, neighborhood restaurant that serves good food, but the pricing makes it more of a special occasion place.  Stick to the veggie dishes, which are plentiful and more reasonably priced.
author: Pearl L.

description: The food wasn't very good and wasn't able to redeem the bad service either. The naan was stale, the rice was stale, and the saag paneer was lukewarm. The cheese in the saag was hard from being overcooked. Our lamb dish didn't have very much lamb in it, but it was tasty. We had to flag down the waiter to get refills on water. The wait staff was friendly but it didn't seem very organized and there weren't very many people there.
author: James P.

description:
Finally, an Indian / Pakistani restaurant I can recommend to my friends with confidence....it's not a hole in the wall like the good ones in the Tenderloin, nor is it overly bougy like Amber downtown -- it has a warm, inviting ambience. 

The cuisine was phenomenal...a full 5 stars for that. My tell for the quality of a North Indian restaurant is always how well they prepare their meat...especially their lamb...anyone can make good chicken (including myself: eternal critc and seldom-chef). 

My picks for the menu - Garlic / Basic naan (melts in your mouth), and Lamb Rogan Josh (beware, very spicy. Let me tell you...as a Kashmiri, I take my Rogan Josh / lamb dishes VERY seriously...it's in my blood. And this one rivals the most authentic Kashmiri Rogan Josh I've had in India)

the -1 star is for the lousy service...we came in around 9:30, when the restaurant was half-empty, and still had to wait 20 minutes to get a table (inefficient)...we decided to wait by the bar, and it took 25 minutes to get a glass of wine and beer (yes, your math is right...we got our drinks AFTER we were seated, even though we ordered at the bar). 

^^ That's nonsense. If this restaurant wants to be taken seriously among the dining elite (which I think it really has potential to do), then it needs to drop the Indian Standard Time and get it's act together with fantastic service. 

PS: Pro tip, they have a little romantic corner table on the left side of the entrance which you should snag if you're with a significant other
author: Meghana D.

description: Amazing tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala. It was really creamy and the right amount of kick to it.
author: Thomas C.

description: Every dish was terrific. Especially the dhal. We asked for the food to not be spicy. Success. The flavours were still rich and wonderful. We'll be back.
author: Jodie F.

description: Favorite place i've found so far in San Francisco for Indian food! The curries are full of flavor and the naan bread is delicious. Service is efficient and friendly. Great mango lassies!
author: Hannah D.

description: My go-to place for Tikka Masala and Saag Paneer and Garlic Naan dishes. On the heavier side of Indian food, but well done and the chicken is high quality. Service and pickup can be slow though, even during slow times ironically. (Have ordered around a dozen times in past year and on 4-5 occasions was 15-20 min past when they said it'd be.)
author: Conor M.

description: Ordered delivery from here. Delivery took 2 hours and food arrived cold. Portions are tiny. The battered and fried veggies were pretty awful, seeing as how they were old and cold. The goat cheese filled naan was a joke. Limp and soggy and barely any filling. Super disappointed.
author: Whitney M.

description:
Husband and I went on a Saturday night. The place was pretty crowded. Service was great. Food was tasty. We split the appetizer sampler, Kashmiri Biryani, and Navrattan Korma. 

We will definitely come again.
author: Blair S.

description:
Great Indian restaurant in the Mission.  Fast no wait at 5:30pm, Sunday dinner.
       Yes it is a bit pricey and smaller portions, but damn good.
The appetizer sampler was small but delicious.  The mango lassi was concentrated and sweet $6 a bit pricey, but worth it.  The tandoori meat sampler was also small portion but just tasty.  The assorted naan was a hit!  The plain naan is good, the garlic basil naan best went great with the daal saag (lentils and spinach). 
     Smelly farts, but wonderful Indian food and service.
author: David K.

description: The food was just okay. The decor is certainly interesting (a little weird), and they serve everything you'd expect to see at an Indian restaurant. The service could have been much better. Overall, it was just an average experience.
author: Laurent L.

description:
We ordered the chicken tikka masala, mixed seafood curry, samosas, pulao (basmati rice with saffron, cumin, cardamom, and cinnamon), saag paneer, and garlic naan.

I loved everything, but my favorites were the chicken tikka masala and seafood curry.  Definitely one of the best Indian restaurants I've been to in SF.
author: Cici A.

description: Great food as usual but their prices have gone through the roof and quantities are distinctly less than earlier. I'm not sure it's a good deal any more. The mixed tandoori platter was a disaster. 6 measly pieces for $22.
author: Mahesh A.

description:
I will absolutely come back here again.
My roommate and I came here and we started off with vegetable pakoras served with two types of chutney. 
I had lamb vindaloo and he had saag aloo, both of which were incredible. I asked for medium spiciness so I  experienced all the flavor without much heat.
The only knock I have against this place is that the service was pretty slow for us, but the food made up for it.
author: Roshan G.

description:
Food was excellent!
Service was a little slow, but we were there at 8p on a Saturday, so easily forgiven.
author: Matt U.

description: Delicious food, biryani and saag. Lively and comfortable atmosphere. Had a great time!
author: Levi G.

description:
This place was amazing! One of the best Indian restaurant I've been to in SF! Staff was very friendly,  food was delicious,  and the atmosphere was great!  Ordered the
Chicken Tikka Masala
The prawns with potatoes
The mixed veggie plate
Some cheese Naan and regular Naan
The rice, and an appetizer of fried vegetables. 
And the mango lassi. 
Everything came out hot and we didn't wait over 15 mins for our food. 
I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a delicious indian meal! Will definitely be coming back!!
author: Coraline J.

description:
I stopped in for dinner at Aslam's Rasoi on Thursday 7-3-14 with my son.  This is the first time I've ever tried Indian/Pakistani Food and was immediately enticed by the smell when we first walked in.  The blended spices were terrific.  I had the  chicken tikka masala and it was excellent!  The service was by the cool guy Ctal and gave nothing but the best service you could possibly expect.  
I highly recommend Aslam's Rasoi and I will visit their again the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Rob F.

description: Extremely late service. I asked for hot sauce which was never served. Asked for water from 3 different waiters before getting a glass. Need lessons in customer service. Can't handle crowd on a Saturday evening. Worst experience.... Don't have anything special to say about food.
author: Moazzam K.

description:
I'm surprised by all the positive reviews, especially given the great Indian/Pakistani food elsewhere in SF.

The main culprit for our disappointing experience was the bhindi masala (okra curry): it was spicy, but that's it. It had no other flavors that you would expect in a veggie curry. And the bottom of the plate was soaking with oil.

The tandoori lamb chops were good, but they typically are.

I also found the techno-Indian music to be grating and the decor (e.g., drawings on the table) to be amateurish. It is a "nicer" restaurant (read: cleaner with real menus), but you more than pay for it with the inflated prices. Mediocre Indian/Pakistani food (with one beer) shouldn't set you back $30 per person.

I'll stick to Pakwan and save myself some shekels.
author: Paul K.

description:
My new favorite on Valencia.

Aziz knows what customer service is all about. He's amazing, making you feel like you're a VIP from the moment you walk in to leaving.

Food is outstanding:
Mixed Seafood Briyani 10+
Mixed Tandoori 10+
Dal - OMG, the best I have ever had
Nan - exceptional, especially the onion
Lamb Korma 10+

More than a few choices for Indian within a stones throw. You would be crazy not to eat here.
author: Steve S.

description:
Eh. I really don't get all the 4-5 star reviews of this place. Going there at nearly 7:00, and the restaurant being mostly empty should have been my first clue, really. The plates were pricey, and while the quality seemed fine, the taste was rather...lacking in almost every way.

We ordered prawn pakora - small, with very little on the plate. The chutneys that came with it were good though. The murgh masala was alright, and the Bhindi Masala seemed to have lots of fresh vegetables in it, but it really wasn't anything impressive.

We also ordered chapati and parathas, but neither of us could tell the difference between the two. I wouldn't make any effort to go back.
author: Kyle D.

description:
My mouth waters just thinking of the tender, smoky and flavorful tandoori chicken from Rasoi's. I get cravings for their seafood biryani which has a spice mix profile that I have been trying desperately to capture in my home cooked version. They also have the most flavorful and creamy chicken tikka masala in the San Francisco Bay Area.

We live a few blocks away from Rasoi and tend to go there quite often and  service is always great and Asif, the son of the owner, always come to our table to say hello. 

I have tried many of the dishes here and most items are either good or exceptional. Their meat dishes are better than the vegetarian ones, however. The desserts and the lassis are good. They serve a very generous portion of wine, I always get the house pinot grigio which is excellent (I am not a wine aficionado but am picky about pinot grigios).

Aslam's Rasoi is a slightly more expensive than other Indian restaurants in the neighborhood but my boyfriend and I always feel like we get our money's worth.
author: Leena P.

description:
We got a nice table by the window and I liked the ambience there.  The chicken tikka masala was yummy but I can't give the same praise to the saag paneer, the naan stuffed w lamb was ok, and I'd have liked the chicken pakora to be crispier.  I'm giving it a 4 stars because though the food didn't impress me the overall dining experience at Aslam's was a good one.

Update:

After many returns I've decided it's one of the best Indian restaurants in the city.  I'm though disappointed with the new menu because I can no longer get the rose water drink. :(
author: J L.

description:
If I could, I would give it a 0 rating. This place was horrible. Not sure why people like this place. We ordered samosas, sheek kabobs, vegetable jalfrezi, aloo paratha and naan. 

-Samosas: ok at best. 
-Sheek kabobs: not good. They were bland and were served over a pool of onions.
-vegetable jalfrezi : Tasted sour and to be honest was one of the weirdest dishes I have ever tried. Not good at all. 
-Aloo pratha: there were no aloos (potatoes) in there. I am Indian and this by no means was an aloo pratha. It tasted really bad. 
-raita: very bland

Service was slow even though there were only 4 people in the restaurant. Way overpriced food. There are many other Pakistani/Indian places for 10 times cheaper and 10 times better tasting.In short, very pricey and not worth it.
author: Shubhi S.

description: The ambiance is very nice and the service was good.   They had some  dishes you don't find everywhere like chicken bharta  (eggplant) and chicken jalfrezi (my all time fav.)  The spice level was good and prices were reasonable.  I'll be back to try the lamb.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Food was extremely good, we went on the eve of the new year's day. Wine was complimentary. Host Asif was awesome and very very friendly and jovial with us.

Must go place for parties, get togethers and family retreat !
author: Saumya D.

description:
Went here looking for an authentic Indian meal but were left less than pleased.  We ordered the Paneer Makhani which looked like it was store bought and reheated.  The taste was also lackluster.  It was a little sour for my taste and had no real flavor.  Also ordered the Vegetable Biryani which was anything but authentic.  Not the worst I've eaten but also not the best.  I was also not happy with the fact that biryani isn't served with Raita and had to be ordered separately.  Traditionally, biryani is always served with a side of Raita.  The naan was very good (garlic basil and onion kulcha).  

In terms of service, we went on a Sunday evening and the restaurant was hardly busy.  Still our food took a while to arrive.  It was hard to flag down the servers as well when we needed something.  All in all, would probably not return.  Udipi and Dosa which are on the same street are much better.
author: Iva S.

description: Great food, atmosphere, & kind waiters!
author: Ashley G.

description: The place is very nice, the food is ok. The chicken korma was good, but missing the fruit and nuts. Biggest downfall, wayyy overpriced. Plenty of other indian restaurants that are good, and half the price. Won't be back, sorry!
author: Alicia S.

description: Excited to have found this restaurant and eager to try more offerings from their menu.  Had been searching for an Indian, Bangladeshi or Pakistani restaurant here in San Francisco that could compare with the same cuisines I enjoyed while I was living in the UK.  My review is based on the few dishes we ordered, which were all delicious and of high quality.  Agree with other posters that it must be some of the best in the city, which also delivers.
author: Lisa V.

description:
I don't know what it is, but the chefs at Aslam's Rasoi must put crack in their food.  The descriptions on the menu or in Yelp reviews just don't do the food justice.  Everything is perfectly cooked, balanced, fresh.  I've never had a dish that tasted "meh."  Even the mango lassi is better than any other lassi I've had.

There are times when you go to a restaurant and the food is good, but you think to yourself, "I could cook this at home."  And with a lot of Indian foods like braised meat in curry sauce, I would think that.  Not at Aslam's Rasoi.  This restaurant is really special.
author: Needles K.

description: I really like this place.  If ever I'm facing an ingredient-free fridge and takeout is the answer, I think of Aslam's Rasoi.  The food is delicious.  The flavors are deep and complex and the execution of the basics is spot-on.
author: Arnab K.

description: Hands down the best Indian food I have eaten. Everything is fresh and the garlic Nan is so goood!! If your in a mood for Indian I would def eat here.
author: Tabitha V.

description: Good basic Indian food. Other Indian restaurants on Valencia that are better but much harder to get into.
author: Rick A.

description:
It's been 5 years since my first review of Aslam... and after trying other Indian/Pakistani places in the mission this place is still THE BEST!  My husband and I usually go in for a drink and order take out.   The food is great every time!   The service is great every time!!

Love this place!
author: Lorissa A.

description:
My friends and I had a really bad experience here because we had the sassiest waitress on the planet. She was so mean! I'm not exaggerating. Everyone at the table was shocked by her behavior. I used to work in food service, so I know how much it can suck to wait tables. But she was unnecessarily mean. I know that medium spicy means, "between hot and mild (plus eye roll)". I wanted to know if the spicy option was going to be palatable or overwhelming. And I know that you don't want to run 5 people's credit cards so please don't talk down to me when we all brought cash to make it easier on you. 

The food was OK. Really small portions. We had a party of 5 and ordered 5 meals to share but we were still hungry. The lamb dish -Saag Gosht- we had was really delicious, but none of the other dishes held up. I've had far better Indian food in SF. I'll stick with what I know and enjoy not getting sassed by lame hipster waitresses.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Came to Aslam's Rasoi for dinner and was blown away by the delicious food I had here. By far the best Indian food I've had and thats thats saying a lot from someone whose been to many different Indian restaurants in the city, no other restaurant can compare. The restaurant was impeccably clean and the service was phenomenal. The chef Asif personally came out to greet me and ask me if I was satisfied with the food and service of the night, a total sweetheart. 

This is what I ordered:
1. Appetizer I had the fresh calamari, (better than pier 39) sauces were delicious & the calamari batter was amazing! fresh calamari with all the right spices.

2. My main dishes: the Tandoori chicken(in love with it) chicken was cooked just right with the perfect amount of spices, Chicken Tikka, chicken biryani rice,  garlic & basil naan (you can see them making the dough in the back talk about FRESH!). 

3. Dessert: Mango lassi, and their homemade ice cream dessert with pistachios sprinkled over (HEAVEN on a plate)


I will definitely  come back very soon, big thanks to the Chef Asif and his sweet staff.
A must try restaurant if your in San Francisco and craving some indian/pakistani food.
author: Ella P.

description: Great food and service! I love the chicken biryani and tikka masala, best in the city!
author: Daniel B.

description: Went here for my friend's birthday. We had a large group, but the waiters were attentive. We ordered all kinds of curry and all of it was delicious. The restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere and we enjoyed ourselves!
author: Emma W.

description:
I was not impressed. I had the prawn korma which was fairly flavorless and the shrimp werent that big -- for 18 dollars I would have thought it would be quite a bit more flavorful. my friend had the saag paneer, there were only like 2 or 3 pieces of paneer and again, not very flavorful. almost as if they ran out of spices when we went yesterday. 

made me wish I had gone for burritos instead of paying 70 bucks for dinner and a glass of wine. samosas were quite good though as were the two chutneys that came with them.

maybe i went there on an off day, but I was disappointed.
author: Tara B.

description: This place is something else. The service was excellent. This is by far the best Indian/Pakistani cuisine in SF. I've had a lot of other places in the city. This place tops it all.
author: Europe N.

description: I'm so happy that my family and I had dinner at this delicious Indian Restuarant .  We were all satisfied with the perfect mild flavors that they added to all of their dishes.  Some of our favorites were the Tikka Chicken Masala, calamari , Tandoori Chicken. SO GOOD!!!!!  We enjoyed it so much that we visited again less than a week later. The dining area is comfortable and relaxing, there is a big window that faces the kitchen were you can see how they prepare the fresh dishes, and the delicious naan . The service is perfect and the price is reseasonable when you leave full and satisfied.  Don't miss out , my family and I agreed that this is the best spot we have ate at all year!
author: Suzie Q.

description: Aslam's Tandoori chicken is authentic and the best that the bay area has to offer. They use a classic clay oven which makes all the difference.
author: Aditya M.

description:
I wrote a review in 2009 about this place with a 5 star rating. In 2013, I feel the same. Still love the atmosphere and I know that Aslam's food is always on point. 

I can't get past people comparing this place to naan and curry. There's really no comparison-- two completely different dining experiences. 

Delicious food, great wine, friendly staff. Always an excellent experience!
author: Neek W.

description:
Excellent Indian food in the Mission. Came here with in a group of seven around 8pm on a Thursday night. It was a bit chilly and cloudy--perfect Indian food weather. 

Service was quick, efficient and friendly, and the family style meal we enjoyed was delicious, and not overly heavy. We had several entrees, and we asked them to cook everything with the traditional level of spicy-hotness... I hope I remember them all: sag paneer, vegetarian daal, chana masala, chicken vindaloo, eggplant curry, a lamb dish, and another spicy paneer dish. 

Their paneer, no matter which way you have it, was excellent. Perfectly salty and chewy. Everything had great texture (one of the gotchas with Indian food, IMHO), and nothing was over or undercooked, despite the large order and the short amount of time that it took to bring it out. 

The restaurant itself is large: plenty of tables plus a bar, and the atmosphere is welcoming--not too loud and crowded feeling; not too cavernous or cold.

Will definitely return.
author: Allison S.

description:
I remember coming here in 2011/2012 and thinking of it as a poor alternative to Dosa/Udipi restaurants nearby.  That has definitely changed in 2013.. I have been pretty impressed with their food whenever I have ended up here over the past couple of months (usually for a grubwithus!).
Great veggie entrees, especially the Navrattan Korma. Fast/friendly service, and they always have lots of seating available. This is more of a generic indian restaurant than Dosa and Udipi (which serve some of the best South Indian and Chaat in the city), but this place is a pretty good bet if you want good North Indian food in a quieter, less bustling setting!
author: Aditya M.

description: We were staying in San Francisco for a conference and found this place through Yelp. Food was delicious, service was great.
author: Amy H.

description:
The best indian food I've ever had! The waiter was one of the best waiters I've yet to be waited on by.
Superb...and Aziff should get a raise.
author: Drew M.

description:
This is the best sit down Indian food in town.  Places in the same price point are acceptable, but for straight up Indian none compare.  Dosa is fine to show off with friends, and it is good but different so not an everyday Indian (ew who would want to eat Indian food everyday anyway).  Amber and all their red headed step children in the city can suck my brown one...the biggest rip off Indian ever because the food does not warrant the price.  I still love Pakwan for the dive and dirty.  Udupi Palace is the worst palace I've ever been to.  There are so many others I've tried in the city as well, and if I can't even remember them well duh.  

This is my go to in town after wasting so much time at other places.  Dont get me wrong, it's not spectacular, just the best in SF.  The Bombay pakoras are fantastic...fried with chick pea batter yummm.  The shrimp madras will blow your mind.  The palak is great.  The dal saag is unique...I have them add shrimp to take it up a notch.  You have to get the dishes medium-hot to get the full flavors because medium is bland, and hot is inedible.  Nothing here has ever disappointed except...

The take out...very odd, but it's never as good as in house.  The vege dishes come out super bland.  Trust me, we have a pretty solid track record by now.

The biryani is not my style..it's on the dry end which I don't like.  I like a wetter biryani but to each their own.  

OK have to leave it on a positive note because it is good.  Great staff, chill atmosphere!
author: A A.

description: There is a reason this restaurant has remained around so long; the food is consistently very good.  The sauces are rich and complex and the meats are always good quality.  In the ever pricier Mission, this place is a great value.
author: Peter H.

description: The service was awesome but the food was not! The chicken tikka masala was terrible. Lacked flavor and was super runny. The naan was ok and I did not like the pakora appetizer either. I hate to say it because like I said the service was great, just wish the food matched...
author: Mallory R.

description:
Solid but unmemorable. I was there on a Sunday night around 8:30 on Thanksgiving weekend and it was virtually empty, so we had a great center table with no noise or anything. The waitress was good and attentive and kept our water glasses full. 

The food was standard Indian food quality. I enjoy all the dishes and there was nothing wrong with any of it, but it didn't stand out as above average or special. I would return for a generic indian dinner, but would not come back for any one dish.

The restaurant is spacious and nicely decorated and a pleasant experience overall.
author: Jordan C.

description:
I've been going here a couple years now, and I just like it better and better. Have gotten to know Asif, the owner, a little, and he's a real sweetheart - always has a smile on his face. The only thing I would add to my previous review is: get the lamb biryani. I have no idea why it took us so long to order it, but it's outta sight and now part of our regular rotation. We get takeout from here at least once every week or two, which is saying something because it's out of the way and parking's murder - we're clearly addicted! 

In addition, I would say this is also a pretty good place for dinner with kids / families, as long as you go early (before 6pm). The staff is quite accommodating and friendly. It's also great for large family dinners, but call ahead. 

I now feel that AR is the "Goldilocks" of Indian restaurants: much better quality than its cheaper cousins, but not so fancy-schmancy (and expensive) as Dosa & Amber. Perfect happy medium  : )
author: S G.

description:
To my surprise, this Indian joint was extremely delicious!

I actually came here since every other restaurant in town on the labor day weekend was packed and not taking reservations, but this was definitely a pleasant alternative!

No hassle, no wait, you walk in being seated right away. The server was extremely bubbly and courteous, explaining the specials of the day and the ambiance was great, with lit dim candles and upscale glassware.

We ordered the following:

Appetizer: Samosa
So good this is a MUST TRY! The spices explode in your mouth but isn't too overwhelming, creating the perfect balance of deliciousness!

Main Course: Chicken Tika Masala & Paneer Makhani
Both were very good and tastes amazing with the garlic basil nan. The Chicken Tika Masala was sweeter than I'd expected, but still creamy and delicious. The Paneer is a great vegetarian dish, as this is just tomato sauce over cheese bits. 

Bread: Garlic Basil Nan
Delicious but I wish this was a little more fluffy. It was more on the crispy side.

Overall, I would definitely visit again if I was in town since I had a great experience and food and service were both spot on at the same time. This may also make a great date spot!
author: Luby H.

description:
I'm kind of surprised that I was so unhappy with my meal. 

It started off really well: we walked in, were seated promptly, and had orders for appetizers and drinks taken immediately.

Samosas were fantastic, the Taj Mahal lager they had was a flavorful lager that bf really enjoyed. It kind of went downhill from there...

1) Really REALLY small portions! $14 for a lamb korma that had less than ten small cubes of lamb (they were roughly 1-inch cubes, some smaller). My bf said it was really good, but he was sad about how little meat he got. The veggie jalfreezi needed to be at least 2-3 times bigger to be worth $11. It also felt really processed, there was definitely frozen corn/peas/carrots in the mix, which really makes the dish look and taste cheap. The sauce for the jalfreezi was thin and a bit runny.

2) You get nickeled and dimed here. No sauces, no sides included in any meals. We had to order a side of tzatiki as well as any carb (rice/naan) that we wanted for our food. With how small the portions are for the price, I would've expected at least rice included. No such luck. We had to order two portions of garlic and basil naan. It was super tasty, but we only got 4 squares of pita per order ($3 an order). 

3) Friendly service but slow slow slow. It wasn't very packed, but nobody ever refilled our water and it took us about 10 minutes of waiting and waiving people down to get our check. 

Sucks, but in the end, I would never go back. I paid roughly $65 for what should've been a $30 meal in terms of quality, service, size of portions. It isn't bad food, its just not worth it at ALL.
author: Emily H.

description: My new favorite Indian place. I usually can't enjoy Indian food since I can't eat anything that's even mildly spicy but the food here was delicious! I especially appreciated the fact that I could order any dish on the menu NOT spicy :)
author: Maayan S.

description: Delicious. Most flavorful Indian food I've had in SF. Get the Chicken Jalfrezi.
author: Munaf A.

description: Aslam's is one of my favorite restaurants in the city!    So much so that we had our wedding reception here!   The staff all the way from the attentive waiters to the manager are top-notch!   I have tried so many things on the menu and every single one was superb.  Favorites are the Murgh Mahkani (chicken in a mild tomato cream sauce) :  melts in your mouth.  Prawn Korma is another of my favorites.  Delicious!  Your choice of about 6 different types of Naan are great. (garlic Naan is the best)   Indian beer available is great.  Desserts round out the meal perfectly.
author: Ken B.

description:
Indian Done Just Right

We love it when a place has vegetarian specials for dinner. The Tandoori Paneer was excellent. So was the eggplant curry and the garlic basil naan. Oh, and the mint chutney. 

Compared to some of the Indian places in the vicinity, this place is more traditional in the presentation. Solid and flavorful dishes. The portions were just right, and the quality of the experience on target for the price.
author: David S.

description:
This is by far my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco. Everything we order is amazing. Often times, Indian food can end up being too oily or greasy, but not Aslam's Rasoi. There's a great balance to all the dishes. Our favorites include their samosas, the saag paneer, the rogan josh, and the navrattan korma. They also make fantastic mango lassis. 

We have never had a bad experience here. The staff are all great, and it's a great place for large parties since it's pretty spacious. I just wish they also delivered, since parking can be difficult.
author: Eileen N.

description:
We were looking for an Indian place for dinner in the mission and this place was highly recommended. The naan was perfectly done with the right amount of chewy inside and crispy outside. Then why doesn't this place get 5 stars? Well, the food and service were good, but not good enough to be memorable or return to. I was starving before the meal, so I would have been easily impressed but everything was just okay.
I would recommend Aslam's Rasoi if you were in the area and craving Indian food, however, not worth going out of your way to check this place out.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The food was Delicious! Flavorful sauce, tender meat. Decent sized portions. 

The service was prompt. Very friendly staff, courteous and attentive.

The atmosphere was relaxed. Not overly hip and bustling, but intimate.
author: Justine S.

description:
My roommate and I love coming to this place, and have been here 3 times now. 

The tandoori chicken is GREAT, and everything else you order on the menu is going to be well-cooked and flavorful. Servers are helpful, patient, and the food gets to you pretty quick. Add a convenient location a short walk from BART, and you've got yourself a nice little go-to for Pakistani and Indian.

One thing I will say is that it is a little pricey for what you get, especially as far as appetizers go. However, if you're willing to stretch a little bit, it is a wonderful place to go with some friends and get some great south Asian food.
author: Sev G.

description:
food was very good, although the service was poor.  

We sat for about 5-10 minutes before anyone even noticed us.  We even asked for help and were told to hold on.  

That being said, I tend to be pretty forgiving, especially when the company I am in  is great.  So, I'll be back!
author: Matt V.

description:
The food at Aslam's Rasoi is simply lacking the spirit of good Indian cuisine.  

The tandoori chicken is under-marinated; its center is completely bland.  There's no real spice in the sauced dishes and by that I mean aromatics.  A great dish should have whole spices in it and there should be bones, not just chunks of dry, lean cubed meat a la Safeway.  Everything is thin and "soupy" -- never a good sign -- even the gobi aloo which is frankly impossible to screw up.

Most offensive was one lamb dish that was brought out at a rolling boil -- as if we were eating tofu soup in a Korean joint.  Curries don't need to boiled violently -- there's a reason they taste great straight off a competently done buffet, more so when they're prepared to order.  Boiling destroys the delicate aromatics that make Indian food great.

The only decent items were the saag paneer and the surprisingly good naan.

I am a strong partisan of great Indian/Pakistani food, and this place is definitely off my list -- Lahore Parahi, Naan'n'Curry in South Bay, even Pakwan down the street are all better bets.  Not to mention a hundred other places, most of which are cheaper and easier.
author: J W.

description:
Disappointed. Got a takeout of paneer tikki korma that was basically cream with no other strong flavors and aloo gobi that also lacked flavor while also being a little spicey. The naan was fine. The vegetables were pretty hard and not cooked totally. 

It was certainly edible but just not a place I'd go back to.
author: Ojus P.

description:
So far the best indian food I have ever eaten 

I highly recommend you try this restaurant. The service was excellent too.
author: Jeff C.

description: I'm not sure why this restaurant has 4 stars... The food was subpar. The chicken felt like it was pre-chewed and portions were tiny. The service was bad. This restaurant has nothing going for them besides the Valencia location. Can't wait for something better to open instead.
author: Gulshan L.

description: A little pricey, but amazing food. Each dish has a different gravy. Achari murg and tandoori platter are really amazing!
author: Roma M.

description:
Aslam's Rasoi has great food, lovely ambiance, sure...sure. All true. 

However, their staff, particularly Asif, are downright LOVELY. He makes it totally worthwhile to choose this place over the others like it on the same street.
author: Anastasia Z.

description:
Ate here with my husband a few nights ago.  This restaurant is a nice size for SF, there was actually a rather large party their at the same time as us and they didn't take up the entire restaurant.  The atmosphere is pleasant, the restrooms are large and clean. The service was friendly and attentive.

We ate the Chicken Tikka Masala, the cooked veggies, rice, and naan.  Everything was cooked perfectly and had a nice amount of spice (we asked for medium spiciness).  The naan was fresh and hot- it doesn't get much better than fresh naan with butter.
author: Christy L.

description: One of the  best Indian food we ever had. Loved our server. He was very welcoming. Would come here again when we visit SFO.
author: Love F.

description: Don't bother making a reservation on open table. You'll get an confirmation email and then when you get there, they'll tell you they stopped taking reservations on open table because it was busy. What's the point of even using open table as a business?
author: Todd S.

description: I ordered a chicken tikka masala. The sauce was good; not super thick like mayonnaise, which I've had at other places. I thought the chicken was a bit dry, but real chicken breast usually is so it may have been that reason. Overall not bad and they gave me a nice window seat.
author: John F.

description:
Stay away!

Food was rather dull and bland. Nothing terribly wrong, but for the prices they charge I was expecting proper Indian food. 
Our waiter added an automatic 20% tip; we were only 4 adults so I was rather surprised. A day later I check their menu which states that they add only 18% gratuity for parties of 4 or more.

If you don't like your waiter stealing from you, go elsewhere. If you like good Indian food, go somewhere else as well.
author: Marc D.

description:
If Indian food is one of your favorite, you got to try this restaurant.

Well priced, delicious food, good service.
So far for me, among the top 3 best Indian place I tried!

Highly recommended!!!
author: Patrick P.

description:
This is the first Indian food I've had in almost two years - since I was last in the Bay Area, in fact (I've never felt compelled to eat Indian in Seattle). But it's also easily some of the best Indian food I've had in a long, long while, even prior to that. Aslam's is actually a family run restaurant, with the current owner, Asif (who was waiting on our table), having taken over the place after his father.

Our group of four ended up ordering the vegetable biryani, machchi makhani, and rogan josh, while Asif comped us a gobi pakoras (one of the guys in my party has been a long-time patron of Aslam's), all of which were solid and tasty. 

The gobi pakoras was a lightly battered cauliflower dish that went well with the two sauces on the table, while the biryani was a surprisingly light rice dish that went well with the two curries. Of the two curries, I was a bigger fan of the lamb rogan josh - a nice and spicy dish which could have benefited from more tender lamb though. The tilapia makhani was also good, but a bit sweeter and milder than I prefer (because the one who ordered it doesn't handle spice as well).

I was already far too stuffed by the end, but the others in the table ordered a couple rounds of Aslam's chai. Stealing a sip from one of them, I was actually surprised at how light it was - all the chai teas I've tried up until have been far too sharp and overwhelming for my tastes, so it'd be reasonable to say this was actually the best chai I've had to date.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Saw the Yelp reviews, and we're always in search of a good Indian place.  We had the appetizer assortment (samosa, pakora and papadum) - good but nothing out of this world.  Then we had the chicken tikka masala and the chicken madras with regular naan (both mild).  They were delicious, especially the tikka masala with very vivid tomato flavors.  However, I have to agree with previous reviews that the serving sizes were very small.  My husband and I are not big eaters and usually have leftovers.  We didn't tonight so I don't think what we ordered would have been enough for some folks.  If they just threw in some more chicken pieces, which can't be that much more of a cost, it would be perfect.  It made it worse that the few pieces you get are floating in a big plate full of (delicious) sauce.

The service was wonderful, though - not rushed at all and very solicitous.
author: B. Y.

description: Excellent food and service. Great for groups and date night. Recommend the goat cheese naan and chicken tikka masala! For something special, try the spiced rum mango lassi. Will definitely come back.
author: Cindy V.

description:
I LOVE this place!!

I was craving Indian food so my bf and I stopped here for some Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan. It was delicious. While Chicken Tikka Masala is very creamy and heavy, I felt that their version used very fresh ingredients which made it not as much so. The chicken was cooked savory and tender.
We also had the fish appetizer and a salad as well. Both were very tasty.

On the beverages side, they had a great mango lasso and a house made lemonade that wasn't too sweet.

Service was awesome as well. The wait staff was very attentive but not overbearing. I can't wait to come back!
author: Aggie Z.

description: This place is amazing! We got the prawns in coconut curry and chicken in tomato cream sauce with a mixed basket of naan.  The naan dipped in the sauce was delish.  Great atmosphere, reasonable priced and friendly/helpful staff.
author: Bobbi R.

description:
I really don't want to write this review.  I really don't want my favorite neighborhood eatery to get too crowded. 

The service here is ALWAYS exemplary and beware: the delicious bottomless chai will wire you.  We have tried numerous dishes here and have never been disappointed (other that feeling we ate WAY too much by the end of the meal).  This place is home.
author: Mark O.

description: Me and my friend gotten the chicken tikka masala.  Thought it was pretty good.  Decent amount of chicken but I honest thought there could have been more (given it was on a large plate with generous amounts of curry sauce).  The garlic naan was really good and crispy.  Service was pretty good.
author: Eric N.

description:
Tasty Indian food aside, the wait staff really made our night here. I came with co-workers for a birthday and they went out of their way to make it a party despite it being a cold quiet night for them. Our waiter, I forgot his name :(, brought over a complimentary cardamom bombed dessert along with a big bottle o' pink bubbly at the end of the meal.

Nice ambiance, and usually I'm allergic to the faux Azn glitz, but somehow the soft orange and Pottery Barn exotic worked out.

Food was excellent. You get to pick level of spice and for once, the spicy actually kicked me in the face and made me cry an ittle bittle. I had my standard lamb since I love the ba ba pain and suffering of it all. Nice juicy chunks of it in a creamy yellow sauce. I tried my co-workers scallop curry too and somehow the heavy spicing didn't knock the seafood off like usual.

We obviously tipped harddd.
author: Kevin L.

description:
This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco.  I always share a mixed Tandoori grill with my dining partner and then get one of the vegetable dishes to share as well.  Add some rice, naan, and wine and I'm happy.  

It isn't inexpensive, but it's reasonably priced for the quality.  (I've paid the same at other Indian restaurants with food I liked a lot less.)
author: Jeff S.

description:
Not as good as expected.  Expectations were running high.  Highly recommended. Ordered CTM and lamb. Very mediocre and not really hot-warm- (the naan was store bought or at least re-heated.)

Still in search of an Nothern Indian place in the City that I fancy.
author: Flo B.

description:
I am perplexed by the reviews for this restaurant. I was really excited to try this place out, but the experience was far from exceptional. 

Positives:
- Garlic basil naan was ideal: warm, both fluffy and crunchy
- Got to try shiraz from India, and it was surprisingly good.

Negatives:
- Ambience: the place is crammed with tables and chairs, which creates a bit of a cafeteria-like atmosphere.
- Every dish we ordered was quite bland -- We weren't sure what their usual spice level is, so we ordered Medium spicy, which equaled out to really no heat at all. Very disappointing. Maybe we're used to South Bay venues that don't take it down that far?

Neutrals:
- Service was fine. Good, but nothing to write home about.

Overall, out of my group of four, no one felt satisfied by the meal.

The Indian restaurants nearby looked much more crowded and popular, but I trusted Yelp more than good ol' fashioned restaurant instinct/know-how. The perils...
author: M N.

description:
Unfortunately, for the price, the quality is pretty low. 
3 years ago, the food here was delicious, so my table and I were pretty disappointed tonight. 
We ordered the samosas which were good. The Navrattan Korma had mix of vegetables that looked AND tasted like they came out of a frozen bag. You know, the kind filled with corn, peas, carrots you buy at safeway.
I wanted to enjoy the Bengan Bartha but I couldn't get past that it had a burnt flavor to it. 
On top of that, the men's bathroom smelled terrible like OLD mopped up urine. It was very pungent. I've been to dive bars with bathrooms that were cleaner.
If you can peak into the kitchen, do so. It was a mess. Sauce containers were left open and the place looked like it hadn't been organized in months. I only mention the mess because i believe it is a reflection of how the food is treated. Maybe if dinner was good, i wouldn't have even noticed the kitchen. 

For the price, this place is not worth it. 
The servers were very friendly though.
author: E R.

description:
Ordered in for delivery- Chicken Tikka Masala* and garlic naan is amazing! Love this place.

*Very spicy, though.
author: Jessie A.

description: This is my go-to Indian place in the Mission. The food is consistently good, and the service is usually quick and friendly. I've done both sit-down and pickup; everything usually turns out perfectly. Their lamb and chicken dishes are especially excellent.
author: Keito U.

description:
Do I really have to give this joint 1 star? If I could, I would give it what it earned- ZERO stars! I was appalled by how terrible the service was! The food seemed to be "dumbed-down" for the YUPPIE crowd that frequents this place,(and all of the Mission, unfortunately, but that's another story). I found the food to be bland, cookie cutter Indian food. It couldn't be less distinctive, or less delicious.

Meh. 

Combine lousy, rude service with sub-par service and jacked-up prices for pretty crappy food, and that equals never again for me! 

Ta Ta!
author: Tough C.

description:
Best Indian food in the city.

We've been here hundreds of times. My boyfriend used to live literally next door to this joint, so this is our go-to place for quality Indian food, great service, local neighborhood spot.. the list goes on!

Highlights:
- Alsam's son Asif is one of the warmest, most engaging, most wonderful people we've met in the city. 
- Goat Cheese Naan, Garlic Naan
- Lamb Korma, Tandoori Prawns
- Chimay on tap - need I say more? :)

We recently had two huge birthday celebrations here (one a month after the other) - and they are always extremely accomodating!

Highly recommend!
author: Helen D.

description:
3.5 stars. The food is good but I wouldn't say it's the best ever there is for Indian food.
Jr. Yelpers kept saying it was not a value meal as it cost $80 for our dinner and we didn't have any dessert or drinks.  Add tax and tip and it was over $100.

We tried:
1. Chicken Tikka Masala - a small plate with just a few chunks of chicken for $13.  It was good but not as good as what I can make at home for less.
2. Dal Saag - $11.  Another same sized oblong plate with dal and spinach.  Very creamy and it tasted good.
3. Full Tandoori Chicken - $20, portions of maybe 1/3 of a chicken for the price of 2 whole chickens.  I could've bought 4 roasted whole chickens from Costco for that price.  The meat was NOT overcooked, not dry.  Good flavor.
4. Garlic Basil Naan $3.00 for a round cut into 4 pieces.  Didn't have enough basil nor garlic flavor, but you need this to sop up the sauces on the dishes.
5. Lamb Biryani, $15.  Basmati rice with some chunks of lamb, mind you, not a lot of lamp pieces.  It was OK. 
6. Plain Naan, $2.00 for another round piece.  This was flakier for some reason but bland.
7. Papadam, $2.00, 2 round pieces of lentil wafers. I liked it!
8. Rasoi's Rogan Josh - lamb chunks in sauce.  It was still spicy even 'tho we asked for mild.  Very pricey for $14 and not that much lamb.

Food is good, the water guy wasn't all that friend but the waiter was friendlier.  I wouldn't give it as high ravings as others have as the price of the food is higher than I think it should be but the food is better than at chains like Naan n' Curry. It's quite popular and I would recommend reservations.
author: Ry T.

description:
Came here as a group of 5 on a busy Saturday night without a reservation but surprisingly got seated in about 15 minutes. 

The food was great but the portions were not the most filling (or maybe we were uber hungry). I ordered chicken bartha and I'm not sure if there was actually chicken in it? Is chicken bartha supposed to taste only like creamy eggplant? Well the creamy eggplant was very good I just thought I would be able to detect chicken. Chicken tikka was extra creamy, which is good for dipping naan but not so helpful in getting full. Overall good tastes, but very busy and loud (if you want to hear each other talk, you might want to go elsewhere).

Service: One of my friends ordered a tandoori salad and it came 10+ minutes after the rest of our food did which was a bummer, but our server gave it to her for free since she had to wait so long, which I thought was very nice of him.
author: Susan Z.

description:
Not sure I would go back...
Though we were greated warmly and seated promptly, service was SLOW and with attitude after that. Our food came all at different times, the order was missing a few items and we had to ask for our drinks 3 times. They came after we had started eating our food because had we waited any longer, the food would have been cold. 
The food was ok but not great. Not sure I would go back...
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
